SectionNotes: The Company ensures the continuous review, verification, and evaluation of its Safety Management System (SMS) both ashore and onboard to confirm its effectiveness and identify areas for improvement.

Details: The Safety Management System (SMS) is continuously reviewed and evaluated through internal audits, inspections, and management reviews.
These processes verify that the SMS remains effectively implemented and aligned with the Company’s safety and operational standards.
Regular reviews help identify potential weaknesses or areas where improvement is needed to enhance performance and compliance.
The Company periodically verifies that all personnel who carry out delegated ISM-related duties comply with Company requirements.
Verification ensures that responsibilities are performed consistently with the SMS and in accordance with the International Safety Management (ISM) Code.
This process maintains the reliability and integrity of safety and operational performance across the organization.

Questions.QuestionText: 1. What is the main purpose of continuously reviewing and evaluating the SMS?
Options: B. To ensure effective implementation and identify areas for improvement
C. To prepare for flag inspections only
D. To satisfy the annual audit requirement only
Questions.Reason: Regular review and evaluation ensure the SMS is effectively implemented and continuously improved to meet company standards.

Questions.QuestionText: 2. Which of the following methods is used to verify the SMS onboard and ashore?
Options: B. Internal audits, inspections, and reviews
Questions.Reason: Internal audits, inspections, and reviews are key methods to verify the effectiveness of SMS implementation both onboard and ashore.

Questions.QuestionText: 3. Why does the company verify delegated ISM-related tasks?
Options: A. To ensure these tasks are performed according to company requirements and the ISM Code
C. To update crew contact lists
Questions.Reason: Verification confirms that delegated ISM duties are carried out correctly and in conformity with company and ISM Code requirements.

Questions.QuestionText: 4. What is the benefit of identifying potential improvement areas during SMS review?
Options: A. It allows the company to reduce audit frequency
B. It supports continuous improvement and strengthens overall safety management
C. It limits responsibility for the DPA
Questions.Reason: Identifying improvement areas promotes continual enhancement of the SMS, increasing safety and operational efficiency.

Questions.QuestionText: 5. Who is responsible for ensuring SMS effectiveness onboard?
Options: A. The Master and all department heads under company guidance
Questions.Reason: The Master and senior officers ensure onboard SMS compliance, supported by company oversight and internal audits.
ISM stands for International Safety Management, which defines standards for safe ship operation and pollution prevention.
